newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian call rates ease, gilt prices seen rallying.
newsitem.headline: Indian call rates ease, gilt prices seen rallying.

text.p: Indian call money rates opened unchanged at 5.00-5.50 percent on Monday, dealers said.

The call rates eased to 4.25-4.75 percent in latest trade, they said. The rates are likely to remain at the same levels on expected interest inflows and Reserve Bank of India (RBI) foreign exchange intervention, a dealer said.
"The rates are unlikely to fall further as the excess liquidity will be absorbed by the repo auction," he said.
"Today's repo auction should raise some 40.0 billion rupees at 4.75 percent," a dealer forecast.
The securities market will witness some buying interest and prices are expected to see a rally on Monday on low call levels, Vinod Dixit, a dealer at Centurion Bank, said.
The focus will shift to 1999 and 2000 year maturity papers, he said.
